trans-unit.source: Provides an interface that supplies dynamic custom type information for an object.
The ICustomTypeDescriptor interface allows an object to provide type information about itself.
Typically, this interface is used when an object needs dynamic type information.
In contrast, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class provides static type information that is obtained from metadata.
For example, ICustomTypeDescriptor is used in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] to provide type information for COM objects.
COM objects do not support properties or attributes.
Therefore, the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] uses ICustomTypeDescriptor to implement properties and attributes for COM objects.

To provide dynamic custom type information, a class can implement ICustomTypeDescriptor or derive from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CustomTypeDescriptor> class, which provides a simple implementation of this interface.
> [!NOTE] > There is no design-time support for data binding to objects that implement the ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.
In addition, when binding to a runtime instance of ICustomTypeDescriptor, the public properties of the underlying type are ignored.
Returns a collection of custom attributes for this instance of a component.
The return value is never `null`.
Implementers can return an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> if no custom attributes are specified for an object.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection"></xref> containing the attributes for this object.
Returns the class name of this instance of a component.
If `null` is returned, use the type name from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName%2A> method.
The class name of the object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the class does not have a name.
Returns the name of this instance of a component.
If `null` is returned, use the default name.
The name of the object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object does not have a name.
Returns a type converter for this instance of a component.
If `null` is returned, use the default <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter>.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> that is the converter for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for this object.
Returns the default event for this instance of a component.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor"></xref> that represents the default event for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this object does not have events.
Returns the default property for this instance of a component.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the default property for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this object does not have properties.
Returns an editor of the specified type for this instance of a component.

The type of the `editorBaseType` parameter is usually <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor>, but you can also use other types (for example, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.InstanceCreationEditor>).
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the editor for this object.
An <xref:System.Object> of the specified type that is the editor for this object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the editor cannot be found.
Returns the events for this instance of a component.
The events for this instance can differ from the set of events that the class provides.
For example, if the component is site-based, the site can add or remove additional events.
Implementors can return <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=fullName> if no properties are specified.
This method should never return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the events for this component instance.
Returns the events for this instance of a component using the specified attribute array as a filter.
The events for this instance can differ from the set of events that the class provides.
For example, if the component is site-based, the site can add or remove additional events.

If an <xref:System.Attribute> is specified in the `attributes` array and the event does not have an instance of the class for that attribute, the returned array includes the event if the <xref:System.Attribute> is the default event.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the filtered events for this component instance.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component.
The properties for this instance can differ from the set of properties that the class provides.
For example, if the component is sited, the site can add or remove additional properties.
Implementers can return <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=fullName> if no properties are specified.
This method should never return `null`.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the properties for this component instance.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component using the attribute array as a filter.
The properties for this instance can differ from the set of properties that the class provides.
For example, if the component is sited, the site can add or remove additional properties.

If an <xref:System.Attribute> is specified in the `attributes` array and the property does not have an instance of the class for that attribute, the returned collection will include the property if the <xref:System.Attribute> is the default property.
For filtering rules, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A>.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that represents the filtered properties for this component instance.
Returns an object that contains the property described by the specified property descriptor.
The GetPropertyOwner method retrieves the object that contains the property member that is described by <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> parameter.

Typically, this object is required for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor.GetValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor.SetValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods.

This method should return an object that you can use as follows: ``` pd.GetValue(GetPropertyOwner(myPd)); ``` If `myPd` is `null`, your implementation of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface should return the default object (typically, the base object that exposes the properties and attributes).
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the property whose owner is to be found.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the owner of the specified property.
